context.p: You can change the name of a declared external entity and/or the name of the file (but not its content).
To change an external entity declaration, do the following:

step.cmd: Select the subtree of external entities.

info.p: To select the subtree of external entities, click the External subtree.
To choose an external entity, click the external entity's name in the External subtree.

stepresult.p: The right Entity Content pane of the dialog shows the filename of the chosen external entity.

step.cmd: Call up the Change External Entity Dialog.

info.p: To call up the Change External Entity Dialog, click the Change button.

stepresult.p: The Change External Entity Dialog will appear.

step.cmd: Specify the changes of the external entity declaration.

substep.cmd: Specify the new name of the external entity.

info.p: In the Entity Name field, enter the new name of the external entity.

note.p: The name of the entity must be unique within the internal DTD subset.

substep.cmd: Specify the new filename of the external entity.

info.p: In the File Name field, enter the new filename of the external entity. You can use the Browse button to specify the file location.

note.p: If you change the filename of the external entity, the content of the external entity will be written to the new file on the next save.

info.p: To change the external entity declaration, click OK.

fig.title: New name and filename of the external entity specified. Click OK.

stepresult.p: If there is no entity with the same name in the internal DTD subset, the entity name will be changed. This change will affect all references to this entity in the document.
